channel.title: Problem with skulls

item.title: Problem with skulls
item.dc:creator: @I_Uk_0wn4g3_I I Uk 0wn4g3 I
item.description:
@I_Uk_0wn4g3_I wrote:

Loading RuneScape... 317 Deob, improved by Scarecrows Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.method34(client.java:1196) at client.method146(client.java:11763) at client.method102(client.java:7605) at client.method9(client.java:8481) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:122) at client.run(client.java:4266) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
if(s.equalsIgnoreCase("headicons_prayer") && i == 6) try { Image image1 = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage("./cache/Sprites/headicons_prayer.png"); anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441]; PixelGrabber pixelgrabber1 = new PixelGrabber(image1, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440); pixelgrabber1.grabPixels(); System.out.println((new StringBuilder()).append(s).append(" ").append(i).append(".png").append(" Skulls Loaded").toString()); } catch(Exception exception1) { System.out.println(exception1); }

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with skulls
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Remove the trailing ‘/’ on this:

("./cache/Sprites/headicons_prayer.png/");

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with skulls
item.dc:creator: @I_Uk_0wn4g3_I I Uk 0wn4g3 I
item.description:
@I_Uk_0wn4g3_I wrote:

I have added a skull on my client but whenever i attack someone the skull should appear, but it doesnt, instead it gives me this:

Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.NullPointerException at client.method34(client.java:1196) at client.method146(client.java:11763) at client.method102(client.java:7605) at client.method9(client.java:8481) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:122) at client.run(client.java:4266) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
And heres the Skull Icon 
    if(s.equalsIgnoreCase("headicons_prayer") && i == 6)
        try
        {
            Image image1 = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage("./cache/Sprites/headicons_prayer.png/");
            anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
            PixelGrabber pixelgrabber1 = new PixelGrabber(image1, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
            pixelgrabber1.grabPixels();
            System.out.println((new StringBuilder()).append(s).append(" ").append(i).append(".png").append(" Skulls Loaded").toString());
        }
        catch(Exception exception1)
        {
            System.out.println(exception1);
        }

And YES the headicons_prayer.png, is in the right directory!

Read full topic
